sense.name: specific facts related to an event
sense.commentary: DETAIL[+event][+occurrence][+actual] Note: implies truth or falsity of the detail, different from sense 2
sense.examples: The police asked her about the details of the incident The reporter got the details of the story wrong. There is one small detail he forgot to mention.

sense.name: small subordinate components of larger structures
sense.commentary: DETAIL[+structure][+component][+subordinate][+small] Note: focus is on the role of being a small component of something bigger. Note: the detail is a thing in itself, not a fact about something.
sense.examples: This diagram is a detail of the right ventricle of the human heart. The faces in this fresco are drawn in fine detail. I have too many details to attend to at work these days. This job requires meticulous attention to detail. Mary admired the ornamental details on the facade of the building.

sense.name: an extended account or description
sense.commentary: DETAIL[+activity][+account][+extended] Note: focus is on the activity of telling about the event (different from Sense 1) Note: often occurs in the adverbial phrase 'in detail' Note: does not occur in the plural.
sense.examples: The book describes the storm at sea in great detail. He told me about his operation in gory detail.

sense.name: small task force
sense.examples: The minister was always surrounded by a detail of security officers. The commandos sent out a detail that night to do reconnaissance on the enemy.

sense.name: an assigned duty or ask
sense.commentary: DETAIL[+activity][+task][+duty][+assigned] Note: usually preceded by modifier describing the type of task.
sense.examples: The sergeant assigned three privates to cleanup detail. At camp my work detail was to pitch the tents.
